meanings.definition: To fill up again with fuel.
meanings.sent1: After the long journey, the car needed refelling at the gas station.
meanings.sent2: The airplane refelling process ensures it has enough fuel for the next flight.
meanings.sent3: The refelling of the generator turned it into a roaring powerhouse.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter refelled the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The refelling of the lake with water brought life back to the dry land.

meanings.definition: The act of filling up again with fuel.
meanings.sent1: The refelling of the truck was done efficiently by the crew.
meanings.sent2: During the refelling of the ship, the sailors worked together seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The refelling of the gas station was a sight to behold with all the trucks lined up.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was a refelling for her weary soul.
meanings.sent5: The refelling of the plane before takeoff was crucial for a safe flight.
